Run all guardrails and collect results

Source: R/guardrail.R
check_all.Rd

Run all guardrails and collect results

Usage

check_all(guardrails, x)

Arguments

guardrails

A list of guardrail objects.

x

The input to check.

Value

A list with components pass (logical), results (list of individual results), warnings (character vector), and reasons (character vector of failure reasons).

Examples

guards <- list(
  guard_code_analysis(),
  guard_code_complexity()
)
result <- check_all(guards, "x <- 1 + 2")
result$pass
#> [1] TRUE

result2 <- check_all(guards, "system('ls')")
result2$pass
#> [1] FALSE
result2$reasons
#> [1] "Blocked function(s) detected: system"
